div1.p: Lambert informs Truby that the woman who worked with Warner in caring for Lazear and Carroll died shortly after returning to the U.S.

div1.head: Letter from Gustaf E. Lambert to Albert E. Truby, May 3, [19--]
div1.p:
May 3rd year?
Gen Albert. E. Truby.

It is my fault that I had to
wait so long in geting a
reply from Mrs Warner, I gave
Mrs Gray the Address of Universi
ty of Tennesse Memphis where it
should have been Chatanooga Tess.
but letter was forwarded and
a reply has been received which
states that the woman who
worked with Mrs Warner in
taking care off Drs Carroll & Lezear
died shortly after returning to
the U. S. I am sorry but I
don't know any other place
where I could get the information
I let Mrs Gray read the book
Walter Reed and yellow fever
and she also said that Lena
Ac
In to L
Warner was wrong when
she said that some of the
young officers were rude
she said they were allways
very nice and considerate, she
said she remember you as
a handsome blond Doctor
with a friendly smile, you
must forgive me if I add
that I thought it was a good
description
